sections.title: Non-current assets held for sale and discontinued operations
sections.description: Flattened checklist for presentation and disclosure requirements under IFRS 5 – atomic, machine-actionable items.

items.question: Does the entity present a single amount in the statement of comprehensive income comprising the total of the post-tax profit or loss of discontinued operations and the post-tax gain or loss on measurement to fair value less costs to sell or disposal?
Does the entity disclose the revenue, expenses and pre-tax profit or loss of discontinued operations and the related income tax expense?
Does the entity disclose the gain or loss on measurement to fair value less costs to sell or disposal of discontinued operations and the related income tax expense?
Does the entity disclose the net cash flows from operating activities of discontinued operations?
Does the entity disclose the net cash flows from investing activities of discontinued operations?
Does the entity disclose the net cash flows from financing activities of discontinued operations?
Does the entity disclose the income from continuing operations and from discontinued operations attributable to owners of the parent?
Does the entity re-present the disclosures in IFRS 5.33 for prior periods so they relate to all operations discontinued by the end of the current reporting period?
Does the entity separately classify and disclose adjustments in the current period to previously presented discontinued operations amounts that relate directly to disposals in prior periods?
If a component ceases to be classified as held for sale, does the entity reclassify its results out of discontinued operations into continuing operations for all periods presented?
If a subsidiary meeting discontinued-operation criteria is subject to a sale plan, does the entity disclose the IFRS 5.33–36 information for that subsidiary?
Does the entity present information that enables users to evaluate the financial effects of disposals of non-current assets or disposal groups held for sale?
Does the entity present non-current assets and assets of disposal groups held for sale separately from other assets in the statement of financial position?
Does the entity present liabilities of disposal groups held for sale separately from other liabilities in the statement of financial position?
Does the entity present assets and liabilities held for sale on a gross basis, not offsetting them?
Does the entity disclose the major classes of assets and liabilities held for sale, except for newly acquired subsidiaries meeting held-for-sale on acquisition criteria?
Does the entity disclose cumulative income or expense recognised in other comprehensive income relating to assets or disposal groups held for sale?
In the period a non-current asset or disposal group is classified as held for sale or sold, does the entity describe the asset or disposal group?
Does the entity disclose the facts and circumstances of the sale or expected disposal and its timing and manner?
Does the entity disclose the gain or loss recognised under IFRS 5.20–22 and, if not separately presented, the caption in the statement of comprehensive income where it is included?
Does the entity disclose the reportable segment in which the held-for-sale asset or disposal group is presented under IFRS 8, if applicable?
If the entity reverses held-for-sale classification, does it disclose the facts and circumstances leading to that decision?
Does the entity disclose the effect of that decision on the period’s and prior periods’ results?
For fair-value measurements (including fair value less costs to sell) required by IFRS 5, does the entity provide the disclosures required by IFRS 13?
If held-for-sale criteria are met after period end but before authorisation, does the entity disclose in notes the information specified in IFRS 5.41(a), (b) and (d)?
